item.title: Grilled Cheese
item.description:
Ingredients:

Cream Cheese Spread Filling

  • 1/2 cup cream cheese
  • 1/2 cup shredded cheddar
  • 2 tbsp heavy cream

Garlic Spread

  • 1/2 cup mayonnaise
  • 3/4 tsp minced garlic

Grilled Three-Cheese Sandwich

  • 8 slices of sourdough bread
  • 8 cheddar cheese slices
  • 8 provolone slices

Directions

Cream Cheese Filling

  • Combine 1/2 cup cream cheese, 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 2 tbsp heavy cream.
  • Set aside.

Garlic Spread

  • Combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise and 3/4 tsp minced garlic in a small bowl.

Sandwiches

  • Lay out sourdough bread slices a large cutting board.
  • Place 2 slices of cheddar on 4 of the bread slices.
  • Place 2 slices of provolone on remaining bread slices.
  • Equally spoon cream cheese spread on slices with provolone. Gently smooth cream cheese spread over each slice.
  • Press cheddar side and provolone side together.
  • Heat a large skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes, until hot.
  • Brush both sides of the sandwiches with garlic spread.
  • Grill sandwiches for 2 minutes on each side, until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown.

Original from: Walt Disney World Resort - Grilled Cheese Sandwich from Toy Story Land

item.title: Instant Pot Potato Soup
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 large shallots
  • 4 medium russet potatoes
  • 4 tbsp salted butter
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1/2 cup vegetable broth
  • 6 tbsp flour
  • 1 tsp Old Bay seasoning
  • 1 tsp minced garlic
  • 2 cups milk
  • Toppings (Greek yogurt, shredded cheddar cheese, bacon bits)

Directions

  • Mince the 2 large shallots.
  • Peel and dice the 4 medium potatoes.
  • Turn instant pot to saute mode.
  • Add 4 tbsp butter.
  • When butter is melted, add the minced shallot, and saute 4 - 5 minutes, until softened but not browned.
  • Add 2 cups vegetable broth and diced potatoes.
  • Seal.
  • Cook on high pressure for 10 min.
  • Quick release.
  • Add 6 tbsp flour to 1/2 cup of vegetable broth and mix until flour is combined.
  • Add flour mixture to cooked potatoes, along with 1 tsp Old Bay seasoning, 1 tsp minced garlic.
  • Stir potatoes until they are creamy, like chunky mashed potatoes.
  • Add 2 cups milk and stir until they are smooth.
  • Turn instant pot to saute mode for 2 minutes until the soup is warmed through.

Original source: A Couple Cooks - Best Instant Pot Potato Soup

item.title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Balls
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 1 cup icing or confectioners sugar
  • 4 tbsp butter
  • 1/2 cup sweetened coconut flakes
  • 1 cup rice krispies cereal
  • 10 oz package of semi-sweet baking chips
  • 2 tbsp shaved parafin wax
  • 4 tbsp butter

Directions

  • Mix the 1 cup of peanut butter, 1 cup icing sugar, 4 tbsp butter, 1/2 cup sweetened coconut flakes, 1 cup rice krispies together, and roll into balls.
  • Refrigerate the balls for 30 minutes to help them set.
  • Melt 10 oz package of chocolate chips, 2 tbsp shaved parafin wax and 4 tbsp butter over a double boiler or in the microwave.
  • Use two forks to dip balls in melted chocolate, and remove to wax paper.
  • Chill dipped balls in the freezer.

Source: Stella Trask

item.title: Sugar Cookies
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 1/2 cups sugar
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 3 1/2 cups sifted white flour
  • 2 tsp cream of tartar
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1/2 tsp salt

Directions

  • Cream 1 cup butter.
  • Add 1 1/2 cups sugar gradually, beating until light and fluffy.
  • Add 3 eggs, 1 egg at a time, beating after each is added.
  • Stir in 1 tsp vanilla.
  • Sift dry ingredients together:
    • 3 1/2 cups white flour
    • 2 tsp cream of tartar
    • 1 tsp baking soda
    • 1/2 tsp salt
  • Add gradually to the creamed mixture.
  • Chill thoroughly (4 hours, or overnight).
  • On a well floured surface, roll dough out until it is 1/8 inch to 1/4 inch thick.
  • Cut into shapes with cookie cutters.
  • Bake at 350F on ungreased baking sheets for 6 - 8 minutes.
  • Allow to cool slightly before removing to racks.

Source: Stella Trask

item.title: Cracked Top Molasses Cookies
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2/3 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1/4 cup molasses
  • 2 - 2 1/4 cup flour
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1 tsp ground ginger
  • 1/3 cup white sugar

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 350F.
  • In a large bowl, combine 2/3 cup vegetable oil and 1 cup sugar.
  • Add 1 egg, beat well.
  • Stir in 1/4 cup molasses, 2 cups flour, 2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp ground cinnamon, and 1 tsp ground ginger.
  • If necessary, add more flour to firm up the dough.
  • Shape dough in 1 1/2 inch balls.
  • Roll balls in the 1/3 cup of white sugar.
  • Place about 3 inches (7 cm) apart on an ungreased baking sheet.
  • Bake at 350F for 12 minutes or until golden brown and the tops have cracked.

Source: Stella Trask

item.title: Banana Bread
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 4 tbsp or 1/4 cup melted butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 bananas
  • 1 1/2 cup flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate baking chips (optional)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 350F.
  • Cream together 1 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup melted butter, 2 eggs.
  • Add mashed bananas.
  • Add 1 1/2 cup flour and 1 tsp baking soda.
  • If desired, add 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate baking chips.
  • Pour into a large loaf tin.
  • Bake at 350F for 45 minutes.

item.title: Vanilla Cake
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 1/2 cups flour
  • 2 1/2 tsp baking powder
  • 1 small box of dry instant french vanilla or vanilla pudding mix
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 1 cup french vanilla coffee creamer
  • 1/2 cup whole milk
  • 1/3 cup oil
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 4 egg whites

Directions

  • Mix dry ingredients together in a large bowl:
    • 2 1/2 cups flour,
    • 2 1/2 tsp baking powder,
    • 1 small box of french vanilla or vanilla pudding mix,
    • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • Add wet ingredients to the dry:
    • 1 cup french vanilla coffee creamer
    • 1/2 cup whole milk
    • 1/3 cup oil
    • 2 tsp vanilla
    • 1 cup sour cream
    • 4 egg whites
  • Bake at 350F for 30 - 40 minutes.

item.title: Pumpkin Cheese Cake
item.description:
Ingredients

Crust

  • 1 3/4 cups graham cracker crumbs
  • 3 tbsp light brown sugar
  • 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 cup melted butter

Cake

  • 8oz x 3 packages cream cheese, at room temperature
  • 15oz can pureed pumpkin
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1/4 cup sour cream
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1/8 tsp nutmeg
  • 1/8 tsp ground cloves
  • 2 tbsp all purpose flour
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 350F.
  • Make the crust:
    • In a medium bowl, combine the 1 3/4 cups graham cracker crumbs, 3 tbsp light brown sugar, 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon.
    • Add 1/2 cup melted butter.
    • Press down flat into a 9 inch springform pan.
    • Set aside.
  • Beat 8oz x 3 packages cream cheese until smooth.
  • Add 15oz can of pumpkin puree, 3 eggs and 1 egg yolk, 1/4 cup sour cream, 1 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon, 1/8 tsp nutmeg, 1/8 tsp ground cloves. Beat together to combine.
  • Add 2 tbsp flour and 1 tsp vanilla extract. Beat together until well combined.
  • Pour into crust and spread evenly.
  • Bake at 350F for 1 hour.
  • Remove from oven and let rest for 15 minutes.
  • Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4 hours before serving.

item.title: Taco Dip
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 lb ground beef
  • 1 pkg taco seasoning (Old El Paso or similar)
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 2 cups salsa (your preference)
  • 1 cup Tex Mex cheese
  • Slices of green onion to garnish

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 375F.
  • Cook 1 lb ground beef until no longer pink. Drain fat if not using lean ground beef.
  • Add 1 pkg taco seasoning to ground beef. Do not add water!
  • In a 9x11 baking dish, layer:
    • ground beef
    • 1 cup sour cream
    • 2 cups salsa
    • 1 cup Tex-Mex cheese
  • Bake for 20 minutes at 375F.
  • Remove, add green onion to garnish if desired.

item.title: Cold Taco Dip
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 lb of ground beef
  • 1 1/1 cups salsa
  • 8 oz cream cheese, softened
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 1 package taco seasoning
  • 1 cup shredded cheese

Directions

  • Brown 1 lb ground beef until no longer pink. Drain, return to heat.
  • Add 1 1/2 cups salsa.
  • Depending on how watery the salsa is, you may want to simmer off some water to thicken it.
  • In a bowl, combine 8 oz cream cheese, 1 cup sour cream, 1 package taco seasoning.
  • In a 9 x 11 dish, layer:
    • cream mixture
    • ground beef and salsa mix
    • 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
  • Chill in fridge at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
  • Serve cold with nacho chips.

item.title: Peanut Butter Cookies
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter, softened
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 2 cups flour
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 1/4 tsp salt (optional)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 375F.
  • Cream together:
    • 1 cup butter
    • 1 cup white sugar
    • 1 cup brown sugar
    • 2 eggs
  • Add 1 cup peanut butter.
  • Add 2 cups flour, 2 tsp baking soda, and 1/4 tsp salt.
  • Roll into balls, press flat with a fork.
  • Bake at 375F for 12 - 15 minutes.

item.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 3/4 cup white sugar
  • 3/4 cup brown sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 cup softened butter
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 2 1/4 cups flour
  • 10 oz semi-sweet chocolate baking chips (2 cups)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 375F
  • Beat together:
    • 3/4 cup white sugar
    • 3/4 cup brown sugar
    • 1 tsp vanilla
    • 2 eggs
    • 1 cup butter
  • To sugar and butter mixture, add 1 tsp baking soda.
  • Slowly stir in 2 1/4 cups flour. Depending on your butter, eggs, etc, you may need more or less flour. You want a mostly non-sticky batter.
  • Stir in 10 oz (2 cups) of semi-sweet chocolate baking chips.
  • Spoon out onto a prepared baking tray.
  • Bake at 375F for 10 - 12 minutes.

Source: Stella Trask

item.title: Peanut Butter Fudge
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 3 1/2 cup icing sugar
  • 1 tsp flour

Directions

  • Melt together 1 cup butter and 1 cup peanut butter.
  • Remove from heat, and add 1 tsp vanilla, 3 1/2 cup icing sugar, 1 tsp flour.
  • Pour into a pan, let set in fridge.

item.title: Butter and Butter Substitutes
item.description:
Butter

If you look at the recipes on this site, you will notice that a bunch of them use butter, or butter substitutes (technically margarine).

Unsalted vs Salted

I know most baking recommends using unsalted butter, and then add specific amount of salt to the recipe for flavor enhancement.

Historically, our family doesn’t add very much salt to their food, so we find that adding any amount of salt, especially baked goods, makes them much too salty.

Therefore, in our baking, we typically use salted butter, or a butter substitute that contains salt, and then don’t add any extra salt to the recipe.

Butter Substitutes

We have one child who is rather severely lactose intolerant, as in they can’t consume regular milk, yogurt or cheese. Even the brand of lactose free milk can make a difference, as it seems some are better at adding enough lactase enzyme over others. Pro-tip, Lactaid brand seems fine, as does the Aldi and Walmart brand lactose free milks. Kroger brand is not fine, at least in our family.

Therefore, we use plant based butter substitutes in almost all of our recipes, unless the recipe also includes cheese, in which case we don’t bother.

However, depending on what exactly is being cooked, in my experience it seems that different butter substitutes are more appropriate, factoring in taste, extra water added, etc.

I shop at our local WalMart, so this is all based on what I can buy there.

  • Great Value Unsalted Butter: goes in my coffee (yes, I like butter in my coffee), and also used in the cheese sauce for my Mac & Cheese.
  • Country Crock Plant Butter: In cookies, cakes and muffins, this is a straight substitute. However, this does not work for buttercream icing, roux, or bread dough based recipes like cinnamon buns. In the case of a roux, the butter taste is too strong. Buttercream icing ends up with a weird consistency. Bread dough doesn’t seem to rise properly.
  • Smart Balance Buttery Spread: This one I use when I’m making a dairy free or lactose free roux, like for our Chicken Pot Pie, and we also use in bread doughs and buttercream icing.

item.title: Chickpea Orzo Soup
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp minced onion rehydrated
  • 1 cup diced carrots
  • 3-4 tsp minced garlic
  • 1 cup dry orzo pasta
  • 1/2 yellow pepper, diced
  • 1 can garbanzo beans (chickpeas, 15.5 oz)- drain and rinse
  • 1 can fire roasted diced tomatoes (15.5 oz can)
  • 6 - 8 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
    • 2 tsp basil, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp thyme, some rosemary
  • Salt and Pepper per taste
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice

Directions

  • Warm 1 Tbsp vegetable oil in large pot.
  • Add 1 Tbsp minced onion, and 1 cup diced carrots
  • Cook for 4 - 5 minutes until the carrots are starting to get a little tender.
  • Add 3 - 4 tsp minced garlic and 1 cup dry orzo pasta.
  • Stir frequently over medium heat to toast the orzo until garlic is fragrant.
  • Add 1/2 yellow pepper, 1 can drained and rinsed garbanzo beans, 1 can fire roasted tomatoes, 1 Tbsp italian seasoning
  • Stir together with everything else.
  • Add 6 - 8 cups vegetable broth and 1 Tbsp lemon juice.
  • Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
  • Serve in a bowl.

Nutritional Information

  • 1 cup (or small bowl) is ~ 210 Kcal.

Sourced and modified from Profusion Curry Chickpea Orzo Soup.

item.title: Chili
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 tbsp. cooking oil
  • 1 tbsp minced onion, rehydrated
  • 3 cloves minced garlic / 3 tsp minced garlic
  • 2 tbsp. tomato paste
  • 1 - 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
  • 1 1/2 tbsp. chili powder
  • 1 tsp. ground cumin
  • 1 tsp. dried oregano
  • 2 (15-oz) cans kidney beans, drained
  • 1 (28-oz) can crushed tomatoes

Toppings

  • Shredded cheddar
  • Sour cream
  • Thinly sliced green onions

Directions

  • In a large pot over medium heat, heat 1 tbsp oil.
  • Add 1 tbsp minced onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
  • Stir in 3 tsp minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more, then add 2 tbsp tomato paste, stirring to combine.
  • Add 1 - 1 1/2 lbs ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Drain fat and return to heat.
  • Add 1 1/2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, and season generously with salt and pepper.
  • Pour in 2 cans (15 oz) of drained and rinsed kidney beans, and 1 can (28 oz) of crushed tomatoes and bring chili to a boil.
  • Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes.
  • Season with more salt and pepper, if necessary

item.title: Roasted Sweet Potatoes
item.description:
Time

  • Prep: 10 minutes
  • Cook: 30 - 35 minutes

Ingredients

  • 4 cups chopped peeled sweet potato
  • 1 sweet onions (such as Vidalia®), cut into wedges
  • 2 cloves garlic, sliced
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar, or more to taste
  • 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 425F
  • Mix 4 cups sweet potatoes, 1 sweet onion, and 2 cloves garlic in a bowl. Drizzle 3 tbps olive oil over the mixture and toss to coat; pour into a shallow roasting pan.
  • Roast sweet potato mixture in preheated oven, turning frequently, until the vegetables are soft and golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes.
  • Drizzle balsamic vinegar over the vegetables; season with salt and pepper.

Nutrition

  • 220 Kcal / serving

Original source: Allrecipes

item.title: Vegetable Barley Soup
item.description:
About

  • Prep time 30 - 40 minutes.
  • Serves: 4 - 8

Ingredients

  • 3/4 cup pearl barley
  • 1 tbsp cooking oil
  • 1 tbsp minced onion rehydrated
  • 2 tsp minced garlic
  • 2 carrots peeled and diced
  • 1/2 red pepper diced (or more)
  • 1 1/2 cup edamame beans.
  • 1 tsp thyme
  • salt and pepper
  • 8 cups vegetable stock

Directions

  • Put instant pot on saute and add 1 tbsp oil.
  • When hot, add 1 tbsp rehydrated minced onion, cook for a few minutes to brown.
  • Add 2 tsp minced garlic and cook for just a minute.
  • Turn off saute mode.
  • Add rest of ingredients.
    • 2 carrots
    • 1/2 sweet pepper
    • 1 1/2 cup edamame beans
    • 1 tsp thyme
    • salt and pepper
    • 8 cups vegetable stock
  • Set pressure cook for 20 - 25 minutes depending on how well done you like your barley. I found it was still chewy after 20 minutes and quick release, 20 minutes and 5 - 10 minute natural release might be fine too.

Nutrition

220 Kcal.

Notes

  • the original recipe called for 4 cups vegetable stock + 2 cups of water, I used 6 of vegetable broth, and while tasty, it could have been thinner, hence I’ve upped it to 8.
  • If you like a wider variety of vegetables, you could definitely replace a carrot with a stick of celery.
  • The original recipe said 4 servings, but we got closer to 6 and could definitely do 8 especially with any bread.

Originally from WachWhatYouEat.

item.title: Chocolate Chip Muffins
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 cups flour
  • 1/3 cup brown sugar
  • 1/3 cup white sugar
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 3/4 cup milk
  • 1/2 cup butter, melted and cooled
  • 2 eggs, lightly beaten
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips (11 1/2 oz)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 400F
  • Grease 12 muffin cups
  • In a large bowl, mix together:
    • 2 cups flour
    • 1/3 cup brown sugar
    • 1/3 cup white sugar
    • 2 tsp baking powder
  • In another bowl, stir together:
    • 2/3 cup milk
    • 1/2 cup melted & cooled butter
    • 2 eggs beaten
    • 1 tsp vanilla
  • Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, add the wet ingredients and stir until just combined.
  • Stir in chocolate chips.
  • Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
  • Bake for 15-20 minutes at 400F until center seems done or tops bounce when lightly touched.

Nutritional Information

  • Total Calories: 3810 kCal
  • 12 Muffins: 318 kCal each

Sourced from Charishma Ramchanda.

item.title: Quiche
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 pie crust, warmed to room temperature
  • 6 large eggs
  • 3/4 cup of milk
  • dash of dried dill
  • pepper
  • 3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1/2 of a ham steak, cubed

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 375F.

  • Break 6 large eggs into a large bowl and scramble well.

  • Add 3/4 cup milk to eggs and mix thoroughly.

  • Add dashes of dried dill and ground black pepper.

  • Shred 3/4 cup of cheddar cheese and add to egg mixture.

  • Cube 1/2 of a ham steak and add to mixture.

  • Put pie crust into a 9” pie dish, pour egg mixture in.

  • Wrap edges of pie crust with aluminum foil to avoid burning.

  • Bake at 375F for 35 - 45 minutes.

  • Quiche is done when middle is set and stops jiggling.

Nutritional Information

2440 kCal for the whole quiche, and we get 10 slices out of it, so 250 kCal / serving.
